titulo: The Secret of the Dragon Balls
descripcion: Goku, living alone in his own little world, meets Bulma and sets off on a journey to discover what the Dragonballs do.

While Son Goku and Bulma continue on their quest, Bulma tries to teach him the finer points in life, like setting up camp and bathing. Goku goes hunting and runs into Mai and Shuu, who were sent by Pilaf to Skull Valley to investigate a light that may be a dragon ball. It turns out to be a wolf pack, which Goku fends off. Goku returns home with dinner, and he meets a turtle who he decides to help by returning him to the ocean.

As Son Goku and Bulma take the turtle to the ocean they are attacked by a bear, who Goku defeats. Meanwhile Shuu and Mai inform Pilaf that there was no dragon ball at Skull Valley. The three of them go to a remote island in the Emerald Sea to get a dragon ball from Roshi, the turtle hermit, but they can't find it. Goku and Bulma meet Roshi, who is the master of the turtle they helped, and in gratitude Roshi gives them the dragon ball and his flying nimbus cloud.
Bulma and Son Goku arrives in a town where they find the fifth Dragon Ball, but they only get the Ball when they defeat the Monster that is terrorizing the Village.

After Oolong is defeated by Goku, he is forced to join the quest because his shape shifting powers may come in handy. In order to find the next dragon ball, they must cross through the Diablo Desert. Oolong disposes of Bulma's dino caps and tries to escape, but she has ways of making him stay. As they cross through the desert, they are confronted by Yamcha, the desert bandit, and he and Goku do battle.

titulo: Keep an Eye on the Dragon Balls
descripcion: Goku, Bulma, and Oolong are still crossing Diablo Desert. Meanwhile, Yamcha is plotting his revenge. Pilaf sends Mai and Shuu after Bulma's dragon balls. Goku tells Oolong about the dragon balls, so now the treacherous Oolong has his own ideas about them. Yamcha overhears the conversation, and he develops a plan for the dragon balls himself. This begins a battle of wits among all parties trying to get their hands on the dragon balls.

Goku, Bulma, and Oolong continue on their quest in a car given to them by Yamcha, who is secretly following them due to a tracking device in the car. He plans to steal the dragon balls from them. The next stop is Fire Mountain, where supposedly the mighty Ox King has the 6th dragon ball. Goku befriends the Ox King, who trained with his grandfather under Master Roshi. In order to get the dragon ball, Goku is sent to find the Ox King's daughter Chi-Chi, and to obtain the Bansho fan from Roshi.

Once they land on Roshi's island, Goku and Chi-Chi explain to him their dilemma--Chi-Chi and the Ox King can't get into their castle until the flames on Fire Mountain are extinguished. Roshi agrees to give them the Bansho fan if Goku can convince Bulma to get him a date with an older woman. Unfortunately he realizes that he used the fan as a place mat, then threw it away when it became sticky. He then accompanies them to Fire Mountain to extinguish the flame himself with his Kamehameha Wave. He succeeds, but he accidentally destroys the castle and the mountain too. ...

Goku, Bulma, and Oolong arrive in a town where everyone is afraid of Bulma because of the rabbit costume she is wearing. They discover that this is because Boss Rabbit, a.k.a. Monster Carrot, and his goons rule the town with an iron fist. It is up to Goku, with help from Yamcha and Puar, to free the town.

Mai is able to fix Pilaf's dragon ball detector, and they see that Goku and his friends, with their six dragon balls, are on their way to Pilaf's castle to retrieve his dragon ball, the only one they don't have. Pilaf sends Mai and Shuu to meet them and steal their dragon balls, and they get all of them except the one Goku holds. Goku and his companions must then storm the castle to retrieve them.

Pilaf steals the last dragon ball from Goku, who, along with his friends, has been trapped in Pilaf's castle. Goku and his friends must find a way to escape before Pilaf can summon the dragon and make his wish for world domination.

titulo: A Wish to the Eternal Dragon
descripcion: Puar and Oolong are able to escape their cell through the hole made by Goku's Kamehameha wave, but they are too late to stop Pilaf from summoning the dragon. Now they must find a way to stop him from making his wish.
Goku transforms into a terrifying giant ape!

The start of the "Tournament Saga". Goku begins his training with Master Roshi. Also, Roshi takes a young boy named Krillin as his student. Meanwhile, Yamcha, Bulma, Puar, and Oolong are on their way to the city, but they crash their vehicle in the jungle, and later get lost in the desert.
Goku and Krillin find a girl for Master Roshi: a sweet girl named Launch... who holds an alternate personality as the deadliest bandit ever!
Roshi takes Goku, Krillin, and Launch to a large island for their training, which includes lots of running and finding a stone which Roshi throws into the jungle.

Roshi incorporates running across the entire island to deliver milk as part of Goku and Krillin's morning training, thus helping to prepare them for the World Martial Arts Tournament. Meanwhile, Yamcha is training for the tournament as well.
Goku's and Krillin's training continues. They must till land with their bare hands, study, do construction work, move large rocks, swim, and dodge angry bees.
As the World Martial Arts Tournament approaches, Goku's and Krillin's training becomes more intense. Meanwhile, Yamcha increases his own training, causing Bulma to feel neglected.
The first round of the World Martial Arts Tournament begins, and Goku, Krillin, and Yamcha all display their strength.
The quarter-final matches of the World Martial Arts Tournament begin. First up is Krillin vs. Bacterian.
The quarter-final matches of the World Martial Arts Tournament continue with Jackie Chun vs. Yamcha and Nam vs. Ranfan.
After a rain delay and a bar fight involving several tournament participants, the last quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament, Goku vs. Giran, gets underway.
After interviews with Goku and Krillin, the semi-final matches of the World Martial Arts Tournament get underway. First up is Krillin vs. Jackie Chun.
The semi-final matches of the World Martial Arts Tournament conclude with Goku vs. Nam.
Goku fights Jackie Chun in the final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament.
The epic fight between Goku and Jackie Chun continues.
The conclusion of the fight between Jackie Chun and Goku, who has now once again turned into a monster after looking at the full moon.

The start of the "Red Ribbon Army Saga". After the end of the tournament, the group of friends splits up. Goku goes to find his grandfather's dragon ball, Krillin leaves with Roshi to continue his training, and Yamcha, Bulma, Oolong, and Puar return to the city. After bringing water to his village, Nam realizes that it won't last long. He goes in search of the legendary "Roaming Lake", but during his journey he runs afoul of a giant bird. It's up to Goku to save him and help him find the lake.

Goku is enjoying traveling the world on the flying nimbus--that is, until his dragon radar is stolen while he is swimming. He must track down the thief and get it back so that he can find his grandfather's dragon ball. Meanwhile, Emperor Pilaf is trying once again to assemble the dragon balls. There is also a mysterious military force that is searching for the dragon balls.

Goku chases after Pilaf to get the dragon ball from him. Pilaf gives it to Goku, knowing that it is a fake. Pilaf then follows the real one to the village of the Ox King. The Ox King and his daughter Chi Chi mistakenly believe Pilaf's ship to belong to Goku, and a wedding for Goku and Chi Chi is prepared. Meanwhile, the Red Ribbon Army follows Pilaf to the village, also in search of the dragon ball.

Pilaf leaves the village with the dragon ball. Colonel Silver follows him, but Pilaf shoots down Silver's plane. Goku returns to the ruined village with Chi Chi, and they learn what happened from the Ox King. Goku leaves to find the dragon ball. He and Silver both track Pilaf to his underground desert fortress, where a battle ensues.
While Goku befriends and defends a wild monkey and her child, Master Roshi recounts to Bulma and Krillin the legend of the Dragon Balls.
Silver and the Red Ribbon Army search desperately for the dragon ball, but it is Goku who finds it. Goku and Silver then battle for it.

Goku, unconscious and frozen, is saved from the plane crash by a girl named Suno. She takes him back to her house, where she and her mother revive him. While the Red Ribbon Army searches the village for Goku, he recounts the dragon ball legend to Suno and her mother. Goku learns from them that the army has enslaved the men from their village, forcing them to help search for the dragon ball. They also tell Goku that the army is holding the village chief prisoner in Muscle Tower, so Goku decides to go to the tower and rescue him.
Goku makes his way through Muscle Tower, battling guards along the way. Once he reaches the 3rd floor he battles Major Metallitron.
Goku continues to make his way through Muscle Tower. On the 4th floor he tests his skills against Ninja Murasaki.
The battle between Goku and Murasaki continues. Murasaki uses a technique allowing him to split himself into five people--or are there actually five Murasaki brothers?
After finishing off Murasaki, Goku befriends Android No. 8, who helps guide him through the rest of Muscle Tower.
After General White uses a trap in the floor to drop Goku and Android No. 8 down to the secret 5th floor, Goku fights the monster Buyon.
Goku battles General White on the top floor of Muscle Tower.

Goku receives the dragon ball from Android 8, who had been hiding it from the Red Ribbon Army to keep the villagers safe. Afterward they go to see Dr. Flappe to get the bomb removed from Android 8's chest. Meanwhile, Murasaki, having survived the destruction of Muscle Tower, is hot on their trail.

Goku gets the flying nimbus back, and he goes to West City in search of Bulma, hoping that she can repair the dragon radar. Once he is in the city Goku discovers how different city life is compared to what he is used to.
Bulma takes Goku on tours of her house and of the city. Meanwhile, Commander Red sends Haski, a master thief, to West City to steal the dragon balls from Goku.
Haski goes undercover as a fortune teller at the fair so that she can steal the dragon balls from Goku.

The start of the "General Blue Saga". Goku and Bulma leave the city in search of the next dragon ball. They locate it in the middle of the ocean and land on a nearby island. This island happens to be occupied by General Blue and his forces, who are also looking for the dragon ball.

After realizing that the dragon ball is too deep to swim to, Goku and Bulma return to Master Roshi's island to borrow a submarine. While there, Krillin and Roshi tell them about hidden pirate treasure that is supposedly located near the dragon ball. Meanwhile, General Blue sends a scout to follow Goku.
Goku, Bulma, and Krillin go to find the dragon ball in their submarine, and General Blue follows them. Blue also sends his soldiers to Roshi's island to retrieve the other two dragon balls.
General Blue continues to follow Goku, Bulma, and Krillin. Meanwhile, Roshi and Launch must prevent the remainder of Blue's forces from stealing the dragon balls.
Goku and his friends continue through the cave, narrowly escaping several booby traps, while General Blue continues to follow them.
Goku and Krillin fight a robot that is guarding the pirates' secret hideout.
Goku fights a giant octopus. Krillin and Bulma look for the pirate treasure, and they have a run-in with General Blue.
Goku must defeat General Blue and find the dragon ball before the cave collapses.

Goku, Krillin, and Bulma narrowly escape the cave before it collapses. They make it back to General Blue's headquarters, where Goku converses with Commander Red over the radio, and then they go back to Roshi's island. Meanwhile, Blue follows them.
General Blue steals the dragon balls, and Goku chases after him on the flying nimbus.
The chase ends in a strange land called Penguin Village. While searching for General Blue, Goku makes friends with a host of odd characters. Meanwhile, Blue meets his share of odd characters as well.
General Blue takes Arale hostage to get Goku. But Arale displays some surprising fighting skills of her own.

The start of the "Commander Red Saga". Goku sets out to find the next dragon ball on his radar. Captain Yellow of the Red Ribbon Army has already found it inside an active volcano. When he tries to retrieve it the volcano erupts, launching the dragon ball into the forest, where it is found by the protector of the land. This puts him at odds with Captain Yellow, who goes to retrieve it.
Mercenary Tao is hired to kill Goku and retrieve the dragon balls. Meanwhile, Bora tells Goku about the legend of Korin Tower.

Mercenary Tao easily defeats Goku and takes the dragon balls. Goku pledges to climb Korin Tower so that he can become stronger and defeat Tao, allowing him to assemble the dragon balls and wish Bora back to life.
Goku reaches the top of Korin Tower. He meets Korin, the mysterious cat who guards the tower, and he attempts to drink the sacred water.
Goku tries time and again to take the sacred water from Korin.
Goku descends Korin Tower and fights Tao, who has returned to kill him and take the other dragon ball.
Having been defeated by Goku, Tao climbs Korin Tower and drinks the sacred water. He then descends the tower to fight Goku yet again.

Colonel Violet finds another dragon ball for the Red Ribbon Army, and Goku flies to the army's headquarters to launch a one-man-assault and take their dragon balls. When Bulma and the others discover Goku's plan they call Yamcha to pick them up, hoping that they can reach the Red Ribbon stronghold in time to help him.
Yamcha and the others pick up Krillin, who is swimming in the sea. Meanwhile, Goku launches his assault on the Red Ribbon Army.

Goku continues his assault on the Red Ribbon Army while Commander Red and Staff Officer Black argue over protocol. Finally, Goku goes head to head with Black and Red. Meanwhile, Yamcha and the others continue toward the Red Ribbon stronghold.
The start of the "Fortune Teller Baba Saga". Goku finishes off Staff Officer Black while Yamcha and the others decide on a plan.
When they can't find the last dragon ball on the radar, Goku, Krillin, and Yamcha go to Fortune Teller Baba's Palace to ask for her services. Along the way, they pick up Upa.

Since Goku and the others do not have enough money to pay for Fortune Teller Baba's services, she agrees to tell them where the seventh dragon ball is only if they can defeat her five fighters in combat. Their first task is to defeat Fang the Vampire.
Goku brings Roshi and Bulma to Baba's palace, because Krillin has a plan that will help Yamcha in his fight against the Invisible Man.
Yamcha battles Baba's third fighter, a mummy who is much quicker than he looks.
Goku faces the mummy who defeated Yamcha. He then faces Baba's fourth fighter, the Devil Man.
The fight between Goku and the Devil Man concludes. Also, Goku meets his final opponent, a mysterious masked man who seems familiar.
Goku fights his fifth and final opponent, the mysterious masked man.

titulo: The True Colors of the Masked Man
descripcion: The fight between Goku and the masked man, who has now been revealed as Goku's grandfather Gohan, concludes. Meanwhile, Pilaf uses a satellite to spy on Goku.

Goku searches for the car that contains the last dragon ball. He finds it, and in order to get the dragon ball he must fight against Pilaf, Shuu, and Mai, who have the advantage of the power suits that Pilaf created.
Having taken the final dragon ball, Goku returns to Baba's palace to get Upa. Together, they return to the Land of Korin to call upon the eternal dragon to restore Upa's father to life.

Since Roshi told him that he cannot teach him anything else, Goku travels the world looking for new adventures. He meets a young girl whose village is being terrorized by two thugs, so he goes with her to the village to confront them.

On the advice of an old woman whom he helps, Goku goes to a small town looking to battle Master Chen, the strongest fighter in town. Chen, however, has his own fight with Sky Dragon, a rival martial artist from the same town. In order to win the title of Master of Martial Arts, and save his struggling dojo, Chen must defeat Sky Dragon the next day in the King's Match. Unfortunately, Chen is in poor health and cannot fight, so Goku fights in his stead.

Goku goes to a village whose princess has been captured by demons and taken back to Demon Land. In order to rescue her Goku must venture through the portal of the dead and defeat Shula, the lord of Demon Land. Once he does this he will be able to remove Shula's sword from the portal's entrance, thus closing it and preventing any more demons from coming through.

Goku meets a family who has fled its village, which is being rampaged by a monster called InoShikaCho. Goku goes to the village to fight the beast, but two other mysterious fighters get there first and defeat it, for a fee. Later, Goku learns that they are working together with InoShikaCho to scam villagers out of money, and he confronts them. Meanwhile, Roshi continues to train Krillin and Yamcha, and he tells the story of InoShikaCho.

Goku saves a fox named Konkichi from a group of thugs, and they befriend one another. In gratitude, Konkichi offers to take Goku to the airport so that he can get to Papaya Island for the next World Martial Arts Tournament, which begins the following day. Unfortunately, neither has enough money for a ticket, so they go to the carnival to win some quick cash at the games. Afterward they return to the airport, where they run into Fortune Teller Baba. She sees that Konkichi is a crook, and he realizes it, so he runs away and gets into more trouble. It is up to Goku to ...

Start of the "Tien Shinhan Saga". Goku swims to Papaya Island, while everyone else arrives by boat or by plane for the World Martial Arts Tournament. All the competitors sign in, check into the hotel, and meet each other.
The preliminary matches of the World Martial Arts Tournament begin. Yamcha fights an unnamed opponent, Krillin fights Anton the Great, and Tien Shinhan fights a sumo wrestler.

The preliminaries of the World Martial Arts Tournament conclude. Goku fights King Chapa, who won the tournament without even being hit last time he entered; Tien Shinhan fights Nam; and Jackie Chun fights a bear.
The quarter-final matches are decided, and Yamcha faces Tien Shinhan in the first quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament.
The first quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament between Yamcha and Tien Shinhan continues.
Jackie Chun fights Man-Wolf in the second quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament.
Krillin fights Chiaotzu in the third quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament.

The third quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament between Krillin and Chiaotzu continues. Also, Master Shen attempts to assassinate Goku for killing his younger brother, Mercenary Tao.

To impress the ladies Jackie Chun helps Goku and Krillin train for their next match. Also, Pomput's manager attempts to trick Goku into not showing up for his next match, and Launch must save the day. All this leads up to the last quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament between Goku and Pomput.
Tien Shinhan decides to test Jackie Chun's ability before their match. Later, the semi-finals of the World Martial Arts Tournament begin when Jackie and Tien square off.
The first semi-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament between Jackie Chun and Tien Shinhan continues.
Goku fights Krillin in the last semi-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament, and Tien Shinhan confronts Roshi about quitting during their fight.
The semi-final match between Goku and Krillin continues.
Yamcha leaves the hospital to see the final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament, and Oolong secures front row seats. The final match between Goku and Tien Shinhan begins.

The final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament continues. Tien Shinhan uses the Volleyball Technique and the Solar Flare Technique, and Goku fights at full power when he uses his battle strength and the Mirror Image Technique.
The battle between Goku and Tien Shinhan continues. Chiaotzu interferes on Tien's behalf by using his mental powers to paralyze Goku, and Tien uses his Rapid Velocity Technique.
The battle between Goku and Tien Shinhan continues. Tien uses the Four Witches Technique and the Tri-Beam Cannon.
Because Tien Shinhan's Tri-Beam Cannon destroyed the stage, he and Goku must finish their match in the air.

Start of the "King Piccolo Saga". Goku chases after Krillin's killer. Meanwhile, after finding a piece of paper bearing the mark of King Piccolo near Krillin's body, Roshi tells the others of his first encounter with Piccolo.

Goku catches up with Krillin's killer, one of Piccolo's minions named Tambourine. Tambourine defeats Goku easily, and he begins killing the fighters whose names are on the list he stole from the World Martial Arts Tournament.

While Tambourine continues to kill the fighters on his hit list, Piccolo creates a new warrior, named Cymbal, to find more dragon balls. Meanwhile, under Roshi's instructions Bulma makes a new dragon radar so that they can find the dragon balls before Piccolo does, and Goku recovers from his fight with Tambourine.

Goku and Yajirobe fight over the fish that Goku stole from him. Meanwhile, Roshi, Tien, and Chiaotzu leave the still-recovering Yamcha and the others on an island while they go in search of the dragon balls. While on the island, Bulma creates a freezing capsule to preserve Krillin's body. Also, Cymbal fights Yajirobe for the dragon ball he possesses.

Tambourine continues on his mission, paying visits to both Giran and Yamcha. He is then sent by Piccolo to kill those responsible for the death of Cymbal. Meanwhile, Goku continues to argue with Yajirobe, trying to convince him to give up his dragon ball. Also, Roshi, Tien, and Chiaotzu find a dragon ball inside a glacier.

After Roshi, Tien, and Chiaotzu obtain a dragon ball from a group of pirates, they continue on their journey. They find another dragon ball inside a house which is occupied by a man who was previously wronged by Tien, and Tien must face his past. Meanwhile, Goku chases after Yajirobe, who has fled from the persistent boy. Also, Tambourine continues searching for those responsible for Cymbal's death.
Goku fights Tambourine. Meanwhile, Roshi, Tien, and Chiaotzu search for another dragon ball inside a cave. Also, Piccolo sets out to find Goku and Yajirobe.
Goku fights Piccolo. Meanwhile, Roshi finds another dragon ball in the mountains, but he drops it down a canyon.

Piccolo defeats Goku and takes his dragon ball, and Yajirobe agrees to take Goku to Korin Tower to recover. Meanwhile, Chiaotzu finds the dragon ball that Roshi dropped, and with Tien's help they prepare for their battle with Piccolo.
Roshi fights Piccolo. Meanwhile, Goku and Yajirobe continue toward Korin Tower.
Piccolo calls upon Shenron, the Eternal Dragon, and wishes for his youth to be restored. Meanwhile, Goku and Yajirobe reach Korin Tower.

Piccolo reaches Eastern City and begins to take over during a parade for King Furry's twentieth term in office. Meanwhile, Yajirobe begins to climb Korin Tower with Goku on his back. Also, Tien mourns the deaths of Chiaotzu and Roshi and sets out to learn the evil containment wave.

Piccolo captures King Furry and destroys Eastern City. Bulma and the others put Roshi and Chiaotzu in freezing capsules while Yamcha tries to convince Tien to let him learn the evil containment wave with him. Goku and Yajirobe reach the top of Korin Tower. Tien begins his training.
Korin tells Goku about the power of the ultra divine water. By entering a portal in the tower, Goku is transported to the ice maze in which the water is located, and he begins his search.

As Goku continues searching for the ultra divine water, he meets a phantom Roshi manifested by the Darkness. The phantom Roshi takes him back to a fake Kame House where phantoms of all of Goku's friends are waiting. Sensing something is wrong, Goku tries to leave and is attacked by Roshi. Meanwhile, Yajirobe tries to find his way out of the maze, and Piccolo announces his reign on TV.

Goku feels different after drinking the ultra divine water, and he and Yajirobe leave the cave. Piccolo orders the people to riot. Android No. 8 goes to the city to find Suno, and he fights off a band of raiders. Tien masters the evil containment wave.

Piccolo draws lots to decide the next city to be destroyed. He draws West City. As people scramble to get out, Bulma attempts to reach her parents, who live there. Also, bandits break into the Kame House. Meanwhile, both Goku and Tien continue toward Piccolo.

As West City evacuates, Bulma tries to reach her parents. Tien fights Piccolo's newest warrior, Drum. Goku gets sidetracked while helping Chi Chi and the Ox King fight enemy soldiers. Yamcha, Launch, and Bulma prepare to help Tien in his fight with Piccolo.
Goku fights Piccolo, and Yamcha, Launch, and Bulma continue flying toward the battle.
Goku and Piccolo continue their battle while Yamcha, Launch, and Bulma continue flying toward it. Meanwhile, news of the battle breaks on TV.

The fight between Goku and Piccolo comes to a close. Meanwhile, Yamcha, Launch, and Bulma land their plane and decide on a course of action. Also, Yajirobe debates on whether or not he should watch the fight.

Start of the "Piccolo Jr. Saga". Yajirobe takes Goku to Korin Tower to recover from his fight with Piccolo. While there, they tell Korin about the death of the eternal dragon and find out that Kami, the creator of the dragon and the dragon balls, lives high above Korin Tower. He can recreate the dragon so that Goku can bring his friends back to life, but the only way to get there is to use the power pole, which Goku lost during his fight with Piccolo. In order to reach Kami, Goku must find his power pole and return to Korin Tower. Meanwhile, Piccolo Jr. hatches from ...
Goku uses his power pole to get to the Lookout, Kami's temple in the sky. Meanwhile, reporters storm the Kame house looking for Goku. Also, Piccolo Jr. begins to understand his strength.
Goku cannot defeat Mr. Popo, so he decides to stay at the Lookout and train until he can. Also, he meets Kami. Meanwhile, Tien begins his training for the next World Martial Arts Tournament.

Kami resurrects the eternal dragon. In return, Goku agrees to stay at the Lookout and train for three years. Meanwhile, Bulma, Yamcha, and Tien see the dragon balls flashing, and they call on the eternal dragon to make their wish.

Mr. Popo attempts to teach Goku to relax his mind. Also, to sharpen his senses, Goku trains blindfolded. Finally, Goku goes to Mt. Rumble to fetch the sacred crown. Meanwhile, Tien, Yamcha, and Krillin continue to train for the next World Martial Arts Tournament.

After recovering from being struck by lightning, Goku is sent to the woods to train. While there, he meets a family and stays with them. He learns from the grandfather of a fighter named Yao Chun, and he heads to the mountains to fight him. Meanwhile, Tien, Yamcha, and Krillin continue to train.

Goku travels back in time to train with Master Mutaito, and he learns about spirit energy. While there, he meets a young Roshi, and he runs afoul of Shen. Meanwhile, Tien, Yamcha, Krillin, and Chiaotzu decide to climb Korin Tower.
Goku fights a doppelganger created by Mr. Popo. Meanwhile, Tien, Yamcha, Krillin, and Chiaotzu continue on their journey to Korin Tower.

Tien, Yamcha, Krillin, and Chiaotzu stumble upon a village that is worshiping a mountain spirit during a festival, and they take part in the festivities. Meanwhile, Goku plays hide and seek with Mr. Popo to help him detect and control spirit energy.
After a volcano erupts, Tien, Yamcha, Krillin, and Chiaotzu attempt to prevent the lava from destroying a nearby village. Meanwhile, Goku and Mr. Popo continue to play hide and seek.

It has been three years since Goku defeated Piccolo, and the time has come for the next World Martial Arts Tournament. Having not seen each other in years, all the characters meet and reminisce while signing in for the tournament.
The preliminaries of the World Martial Arts Tournament begin. Notably, Goku fights a rematch with King Choppa, and Chiaotzu faces a familiar foe.
The preliminaries of the World Martial Arts Tournament conclude.
Tien Shinhan fights Mercenary Tao in the first quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament.
Goku fights the woman entered as "Anonymous" in the second quarter-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament. Also, the match between Piccolo Jr. and Krillin begins.
The fight between Piccolo Jr. and Krillin concludes. Also, the final quarter-final match between Yamcha and Hero begins.
The fight between Yamcha and Hero concludes. Also, the first semi-final match between Goku and Tien begins.
The first semi-final match between Goku and Tien continues.
The first semi-final match between Goku and Tien concludes.
Piccolo Jr. fights Hero, who is actually Kami in disguise, in the second semi-final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament.
Goku finally explains to his friends the true identities of Piccolo Jr. and Kami. Also, the final match of the World Martial Arts Tournament begins when Goku faces Piccolo Jr.
Goku gets up from the knockdown, and his fight with Piccolo Jr. continues. The fighting is intense, as Piccolo levels a mountain with an energy attack, and Goku unveils his Super Kamehameha wave.

The true identity of Piccolo Jr. is finally recognized by the crowd, which flees in terror, and news of the discovery breaks on TV. Piccolo then uses a new technique to increase in size, and his fight with Goku continues.
Goku enters Piccolo Jr.'s body through his mouth and retrieves the jar that holds Kami. After Kami is freed, Piccolo returns to his normal size, and the battle continues.

Piccolo charges up, stealing energy from everyone around him so that he can unleash a massive energy attack. Tien uses the Tri-Beam Cannon to create a shelter for all the non-participants to hide in, and the fight between Goku and Piccolo continues.
Knowing that if he dies it will also be the death of Piccolo Jr., Kami asks Tien to kill him after Piccolo disables Goku. Before this can happen, Goku recovers and the fight continues.

Goku and Chi-Chi fly back to the Ox King's castle to announce their engagement. The Ox King and his servants prepare the castle for the wedding, but just when the preparation is nearly complete, the castle once again goes up in flames. With the Ox King still trapped in the castle, Goku and Chi-Chi must find the Bansho fan and extinguish the flames.

Goku and Chi-Chi visit the Kame House to find Roshi's instructions for making the Bansho fan. They see that they need a feather from a mystical bird called a fire-eater, so they go to Mt. Kiwi to retrieve one. Once there, they are followed by Mai and Shuu, who are also looking for the bird.

Goku and Chi-Chi reach the mountain that reportedly holds the Bansho fan, but a heavy snowstorm causes them to crash at the mountain's base. They meet an old woman who explains to them that no woman can climb the mountain without causing a storm. She also tells them that there is no fan on the mountain. Goku scales it hoping to gather enough snow to put out the fire at the Ox King's castle. While Goku is climbing the mountain, the old woman teaches Chi-Chi about being a good wife. Meanwhile, Goku is followed by Pilaf, who thinks the fan might be worth something.

The Bansho fan has no effect on the flames because the fire was forged in the Magical Furnace. Goku and Chi-Chi must travel to the other side of the world to Mt. Five Elements, where they must venture through the Gate of the Five Elements into the Dark World. There, they must find Tajoro, the keeper of the furnace, and convince her to help put out the flames.

Goku tries to convince Tajoro to extinguish the flame long enough to fix the leak that causes the Ox King's castle to ignite, but she refuses. This is because the flame is what creates the fog that shrouds Mt. Five Elements, and the fog is what allows spirits to pass between the spirit world and the world of the living--without it, no spirit could ever visit the world of the living again, and all spirits already in the world of the living would be trapped forever. Therefore, they must find another way to put out the flame at the Ox King's castle.
